basics.name: Eon Lee
basics.summary: A third year undergraduate student majoring in CS, minoring in Mathematics. Current fields of interest are Enumerative/Algebraic/Topological Combinatorics.

work.name: Topological Combinatorics Lab, Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology
work.summary: Participated in reading programs on topological combinatorics and computational geometry. Starting from the second year, participated as a speaker in a combinatorics research paper review seminar with Yunho Kim, Professor Minki Kim, Professor Jeong-Ok Choi, and Professor Jinha Kim.
highlights: Review on the paper: Tverberg's theorem, a new proof (Imre Bárány)

education.institution: Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology (GIST)

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
